title: Royal Shakespeare Company Names Two Directors for Top Job
description: In an usual move for a major British theater, Daniel Evans and Tamara Harvey will jointly helm the major British theater troupe.

title: Russia Signals Annexation of Parts of Ukraine, Raising Stakes in Fighting
description: Kremlin-backed officials in four partially occupied regions announced referendums on joining Russia, as Moscow tightens its grip and hints at escalation.

title: Russia’s Invasion Shadows U.N. Assembly Amid ‘Colossal Global Dysfunction’
description: Presidents Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey and Emmanuel Macron of France used the gathering as a stage to cast themselves as would-be peacemakers in the war in Ukraine.

title: Putin’s Address to Russia Delayed After Hours of Waiting
description: The Kremlin did not explain why it was delayed — or even that it had been planned at all. But the caginess telegraphed the rapid speed — and apparent improvisation — with which Moscow is plotting out its next moves.

title: Al Gore Calls the World Bank Chief a ‘Climate Denier’
description: The former vice president also said President Biden should seek to have the Trump-nominated bank leader, David Malpass, removed from his role.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Russia Moves Toward Annexation
description: Plus leaders address a world in peril at the U.N. General Assembly and protests sweep Iran.

title: The Ukrainian Frontline Town of Siversk Is Cut Off From the World
description: After the Ukrainian military’s sweeping victory in the northeast last week, the fate of Siversk, in the Donbas region, appears once more undecided.

title: Prime Minister Liz Truss Pivots From Queen’s Funeral to U.K.’s Crises
description: Liz Truss’s government will roll out major initiatives to confront an array of economic and social problems: soaring energy costs, surging inflation and pressure on public services.

title: U.S. Shores Up Ukraine Aid as Energy Crisis in Europe Looms
description: The Biden administration is trying to keep its allies on board as the Russian invasion has sent energy prices soaring.

title: Ukraine Advances Deeper Into Areas Held By Russia
description: The Ukrainian military has not declared victory yet in Bilohorivka, given that control over towns has proved tenuous in the past. Reclaiming it would signal that Russia no longer has full control of the Luhansk region.

title: Turkey’s President Says Russia Should Return Captured Ukrainian Territories
description: Erdogan has positioned himself as a mediator between Ukraine and Russia and hosted preliminary peace talks in Istanbul in March.

title: Most of the 146 bodies exhumed in Izium so far were civilians, a Ukrainian official said.
Here’s what to expect as world leaders address the United Nations.
Russian Oil Price Cap Will Be a Focus of the U.S. and Its Allies
description: The

title: Lots of Food Gets Tossed. These Food-Waste Apps Let You Buy It, Cheap.
description: Several companies say they are tackling food waste by connecting people with unsold food from restaurants and grocery stores.

title: The war in Ukraine will be center stage as world leaders begin speaking at the U.N.
1922: Ex-Kaiser to Marry Princess Hermine
description: Wilhelm II, who abdicated as emperor of Germany in the midst of defeat in World War I, had become a widower in 1921.

title: Live Updates: World Leaders Take the Stage at the U.N.
description: For the first time in three years, world leaders are convening in New York to discuss sweeping crises that include climate change, food insecurity and the war in Ukraine.

title: Russian Losses Hinder Recruiting, U.S. Defense Official Says
description: A senior Pentagon official contended that Moscow was failing in its strategic objectives and that the U.S. was open to sending Western tanks to Ukraine.

title: Sarah Koenig, the Host of ‘Serial,’ Talks About Adnan Syed’s Release
description: We talk with Sarah Koenig, host of the “Serial” podcast.

title: How a 79-year-old Film Director Learned to “Fly” on a Trapeze
description: Tom Moore made a name for himself as a film, TV and theater director. But his dream has always been to “fly” on the trapeze, high in the air. And that’s what he is doing at age 79.

title: Egypt Feels Pain of Global Disruptions Wrought by War and Pandemic
description: The country’s economy has been very hard hit by cascading crises which have disrupted worldwide trade.

title: Protests Erupt in Iranian Cities After Woman’s Death in Custody
description: The 22-year-old’s death sparked outrage across social, religious and political factions. Four people were reported to have been killed by the security forces.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: The funeral of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: In One Corner of Kosovo, Cheers Still Ring Out for Putin
description: Many ethnic Serbs, nursing grievances against NATO for a 1999 bombing campaign that broke Serbia’s grip on the territory, see President Vladimir V. Putin’s Russia as a potential savior.

title: Russia is struggling to attract new recruits for its army, a U.S. official says.
